title: Announcement, The Third Annual Border Lines Festival of American and Canadian Writing, 1985
title_raw: The Third Annual Border Lines Festival of American and Canadian Writing
signed: Signature imprinted in red ink, lower left edge: Design: Edward Fella
inscribed:
Recto: Imprinted in blue and red across upper edge: 1985/ OCTOBER/ LINES:/ New/ Writing/ at the/ Detroit/ Institute/ of Arts/ Presents/ The Third/ Annual/ Border/ Lines; across upper right edge: FESTIVAL/ of American and Canadian Writing/ (in cooperation with/ The Canadian Consulate/ General of Detroit and/ with support from/ The Canada Council); across right edge: Thursday/* October 3/ 7:30 pm readings/* Lecture/ Hall (book-signing follows)/ THE FOUR/ HORSEMEN...[describes events, gives quotations from literary reviews, biographical information, dates, times, locations, and additional information]... from the Michigan/ Foundation for the Arts; across left edge: Tuesday/* October 1/ 3:00 pm panel discussion/* "reaching the Cross-/ Cultural Audience"/ Holley Room...[describes events, gives quotations from literary reviews, biographical information, dates, times, locations, and additional information]... review La Barre du Jour; lower left corner: ADMISSION RATES FOR FESTIVAL/ AND "OLD AND NEW STORIES"/ Informal Talks...[lists admissions fees, gives contact information]... 833-1858; across lower edge: Friday/*/ October 18/ "Old and New Stories"/ 5:30pm readings/* Lecture/ Hall co-sponsored...[describes events, gives quotations from literary reviews, biographical information, dates, times, locations, and additional information]... Blue Moon/ Press
Verso: Imprinted in blue forming a square around upper two-thirds of sheet: THE FOUR HORSEMEN RAFAEL BARETTO-RIVERA PAUL DUTTON... [lists participating writers, works, and dates]... Thursday/* October 3; across lower left edge, running downward, sideways: The Adress correction requested; across lower left quadrant: DETROIT/ INSTITUTE/ OF/ ARTS/ 5200 Woodward Avenue/ Detroit MI 48202; across lower right quadrant: Non-Profit Organization/ U,S, Postage/ PAID/ Founders Society/ Detroit Institute of Arts 

*The "/" is included in the text.
description:
Poster/ announcement printed in red and blue, for Detroit Institute of the Arts reading, lecture, and discussion series, designed to be mailed.  Text in a variety of sizes, styles thorughout.   
Recto: Across upper edge, upper right corner, text giving event title, sponsors, and additional information.  Center, pale blue.  Blue and red text arranged along edges surrounding center, giving dates, descriptions, times, locations, and additional information. Verso: Upper two thirds of sheet, blue text giving names of participating writers form rectangle punctuated by dates jutting into center.  Across lower third of sheet, blue text giving mailing information.
